ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and then went off to his family, swaggering.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then he strutted back to his people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and haughtily goes to his people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then he went back to his home in pride.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then he walked in conceit to his family admiring himself!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then he went to his followers, walking away in haughtiness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then he went to his household arrogantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then went he to his folk with glee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then he went off to his people, swaggering.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then he departed Unto his house hold conceitedly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and went back swaggering to his family.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then did he stalk to his family in full conceit!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then he walked in full pride to his family admiring himself!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: then went arrogantly to his household.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then he went to his family, full of pride.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:33]   then went off to his family swaggering, strutting about in self-conceit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then went he to his folk) in the life of the world (with glee) strutting and behaving wantonly.
